NuGet.0002.description:
NuGet package upgrade is recommended for selected target framework.

Standard .NET packages are recommended to have versions matching version of .NET that project targets.

Some other packages also are known to work better for selected target frameworks.
NuGet.0002.label: NuGet package upgrade is recommended

Project.0002.description:
Project's target framework(s) needs to be changed to the new target framework that you selected for this upgrade.

During upgrade target framework will be adjusted to corresponding platform when applicable. In some cases project would result in multiple target frameworks after the upgrade if it was using features that now have their own platforms in modern .NET frameworks (windows, iOS, Android etc).
Project.0002.label: Project's target framework(s) needs to be changed

links.title: Overview of porting from .NET Framework to .NET

Api.0003.description: API has a behavioral change in selected .NET version: code and binaries may behave differently at runtime without needing recompilation, but the new behavior might be undesirable and require updates.
Api.0003.label: Behavioral change in selected .NET version

NuGet.0005.description:
NuGet package is deprecated.

Go to its documentation and if there is a guidance for replacement of functionality provided by this package.
NuGet.0005.label: NuGet package is deprecated

Api.0001.description: API is binary incompatible for selected .NET version: affects existing binaries, often requiring recompilation, because the API has changed in a way that prevents older binaries from loading or executing.
Api.0001.label: Binary incompatible for selected .NET version

Api.0002.description: API is source incompatible for selected .NET version: requires code changes to compile successfully when targeting a new version, such as removing obsolete APIs or changing method signatures.
Api.0002.label: Source incompatible for selected .NET version
